verses.kjv: And Rehoboam went to Shechem: for all Israel were come to Shechem to make him king.
verses.web: Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.
verses.ct: Rehoboam traveled to Shechem, because all Israel had gathered there to make him king.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who was yet in Egypt, heard of it, (for he was fled from the presence of king Solomon, and Jeroboam dwelt in Egypt;)
verses.web: When Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard of it (for he was yet in Egypt, where he had fled from the presence of king Solomon, and Jeroboam lived in Egypt,
verses.ct: When Jeroboam son of Nebat heard about this, he was still in Egypt, where he had fled to escape King Solomon.

verses.kjv: That they sent and called him. And Jeroboam and all the congregation of Israel came, and spake unto Rehoboam, saying,
verses.web: and they sent and called him), Jeroboam and all the assembly of Israel came, and spoke to Rehoboam, saying,
verses.ct: The people sent for him, and Jeroboam came with the whole assembly of Israel. They spoke to Rehoboam and said,

verses.kjv: Thy father made our yoke grievous: now therefore make thou the grievous service of thy father, and his heavy yoke which he put upon us, lighter, and we will serve thee.
verses.web: “Your father made our yoke difficult. Now therefore make the hard service of your father, and his heavy yoke which he put on us, lighter, and we will serve you.”
verses.ct: "Your father put a crushing burden on us. Lighten the harsh labor and the heavy load he placed on us, and we will serve you."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Depart yet for three days, then come again to me. And the people departed.
verses.web: He said to them, “Depart for three days, then come back to me.” So the people departed.
verses.ct: Rehoboam told them, "Go away for 3 days, then come back to me." So the people left.

verses.kjv: And king Rehoboam consulted with the old men, that stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, and said, How do ye advise that I may answer this people?
verses.web: King Rehoboam took counsel with the old men, who had stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, saying, “What counsel do you give me to answer these people?”
verses.ct: King Rehoboam consulted the elders who had served his father Solomon while he was still alive. "What do you advise me to tell these people?" he asked.

verses.kjv: And they spake unto him, saying, If thou wilt be a servant unto this people this day, and wilt serve them, and answer them, and speak good words to them, then they will be thy servants for ever.
verses.web: They replied, “If you will be a servant to this people today, and will serve them, and answer them with good words, then they will be your servants forever.”
verses.ct: They told him, "If you serve these people today — if you treat them well and give them a favorable answer — they will serve you loyally forever."

verses.kjv: But he forsook the counsel of the old men, which they had given him, and consulted with the young men that were grown up with him, and which stood before him:
verses.web: But he abandoned the counsel of the old men which they had given him, and took counsel with the young men who had grown up with him, who stood before him.
verses.ct: But he rejected the advice the elders gave him and instead consulted the young men who had grown up with him and now served him.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What counsel give ye that we may answer this people, who have spoken to me, saying, Make the yoke which thy father did put upon us lighter?
verses.web: He said to them, “What counsel do you give, that we may answer these people, who have spoken to me, saying, ‘Make the yoke that your father put on us lighter?’ ”
verses.ct: He asked them, "What do you advise? How should we answer these people who are asking me to lighten the burden my father put on them?"

verses.kjv: And the young men that were grown up with him spake unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou speak unto this people that spake unto thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it lighter unto us; thus shalt thou say unto them, My little finger shall be thicker than my father’s loins.
verses.web: The young men who had grown up with him said to him, “Tell these people who spoke to you, saying, ‘Your father made our yoke heavy, but make it lighter to us;’ tell them, ‘My little finger is thicker than my father’s waist.
verses.ct: The young men who had grown up with him answered, "Here's what you should tell these people who said, 'Your father made our load heavy — lighten it for us.' Say to them: 'My little finger is thicker than my father's waist.

verses.kjv: And now whereas my father did lade you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke: my father hath chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
verses.web: Now my father burdened you with a heavy yoke, but I will add to your yoke. My father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.’ ”
verses.ct: My father loaded you down with a heavy burden? I'll make it even heavier. My father disciplined you with whips? I'll discipline you with scorpions.'"

verses.kjv: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king had appointed, saying, Come to me again the third day.
verses.web: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king asked, saying, “Come to me again the third day.”
verses.ct: So Jeroboam and all the people came back to Rehoboam on the 3rd day, just as the king had instructed when he said, "Come back to me in 3 days."

verses.kjv: And the king answered the people roughly, and forsook the old men’s counsel that they gave him;
verses.web: The king answered the people roughly, and abandoned the counsel of the old men which they had given him,
verses.ct: The king answered the people harshly, rejecting the advice the elders had given him.

verses.kjv: And spake to them after the counsel of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy, and I will add to your yoke: my father also chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
verses.web: and spoke to them according to the counsel of the young men, saying, “My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add to your yoke. My father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.”
verses.ct: Instead, he followed the young men's advice and said, "My father made your burden heavy, and I'll make it even heavier. My father disciplined you with whips, but I'll discipline you with scorpions."

verses.kjv: Wherefore the king hearkened not unto the people; for the cause was from the LORD, that he might perform his saying, which the LORD spake by Ahijah the Shilonite unto Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
verses.web: So the king didn’t listen to the people; for it was a thing brought about from LORD, that he might establish his word, which LORD spoke by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
verses.ct: So the king refused to listen to the people. This turn of events was from the LORD, to fulfill what he had spoken through Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam son of Nebat.

verses.kjv: So when all Israel saw that the king hearkened not unto them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse: to your tents, O Israel: now see to thine own house, David. So Israel departed unto their tents.
verses.web: When all Israel saw that the king didn’t listen to them, the people answered the king, saying, “What portion have we in David? We don’t have an inheritance in the son of Jesse. To your tents, Israel! Now see to your own house, David.” So Israel departed to their tents.
verses.ct: When all Israel saw that the king refused to listen to them, the people shouted back at him: "What share do we have in David? We have no stake in Jesse's son! Back to your homes, Israel! Take care of your own house, David!" And the Israelites went home.

verses.kjv: But as for the children of Israel which dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.
verses.web: But as for the children of Israel who lived in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.
verses.ct: But Rehoboam still ruled over the Israelites who lived in the towns of Judah.

verses.kjv: Then king Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was over the tribute; and all Israel stoned him with stones, that he died. Therefore king Rehoboam made speed to get him up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
verses.web: Then king Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was over the men subject to forced labor; and all Israel stoned him to death with stones. King Rehoboam hurried to get himself up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: King Rehoboam then sent Adoram, who was in charge of forced labor, but all Israel stoned him to death. King Rehoboam barely managed to jump into his chariot and escape to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: So Israel rebelled against the house of David unto this day.
verses.web: So Israel rebelled against David’s house to this day.
verses.ct: Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David to this day.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when all Israel heard that Jeroboam was come again, that they sent and called him unto the congregation, and made him king over all Israel: there was none that followed the house of David, but the tribe of Judah only.
verses.web: When all Israel heard that Jeroboam had returned, they sent and called him to the congregation, and made him king over all Israel. There was no one who followed David’s house, except for the tribe of Judah only.
verses.ct: When all Israel heard that Jeroboam had returned, they summoned him to the assembly and made him king over all Israel. No one followed the house of David except the tribe of Judah alone.

verses.kjv: And when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, he assembled all the house of Judah, with the tribe of Benjamin, an hundred and fourscore thousand chosen men, which were warriors, to fight against the house of Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam the son of Solomon.
verses.web: When Rehoboam had come to Jerusalem, he assembled all the house of Judah and the tribe of Benjamin, a hundred and eighty thousand chosen men, who were warriors, to fight against the house of Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam the son of Solomon.
verses.ct: When Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem, he assembled the entire tribe of Judah and the tribe of Benjamin — 180,000 elite warriors — to fight against Israel and reclaim the kingdom for himself.

verses.kjv: But the word of God came unto Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
verses.web: But the word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
verses.ct: But the word of God came to Shemaiah, the man of God:

verses.kjv: Speak unto Rehoboam, the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and unto all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the remnant of the people, saying,
verses.web: “Speak to Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people, saying,
verses.ct: "Tell Rehoboam son of Solomon, king of Judah, and all the people of Judah and Benjamin, and the rest of the people:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brethren the children of Israel: return every man to his house; for this thing is from me. They hearkened therefore to the word of the LORD, and returned to depart, according to the word of the LORD.
verses.web: ‘LORD says, “You shall not go up or fight against your brothers, the children of Israel. Everyone return to his house; for this thing is from me.” ’ ” So they listened to LORD’s word, and returned and went their way, according to LORD’s word.
verses.ct: 'This is what the LORD says: Do not march out to fight against your brothers, the people of Israel. Everyone go home, because I am the one behind all of this.'" They obeyed the word of the LORD and turned back, just as the LORD had commanded.

verses.kjv: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in mount Ephraim, and dwelt therein; and went out from thence, and built Penuel.
verses.web: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and lived in it; and he went out from there, and built Penuel.
verses.ct: Jeroboam fortified Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim and made it his capital. Later he went out and fortified Penuel as well.

verses.kjv: And Jeroboam said in his heart, Now shall the kingdom return to the house of David:
verses.web: Jeroboam said in his heart, “Now the kingdom will return to David’s house.
verses.ct: Jeroboam thought to himself, "The kingdom is going to slip back to the house of David.

verses.kjv: If this people go up to do sacrifice in the house of the LORD at Jerusalem, then shall the heart of this people turn again unto their lord, even unto Rehoboam king of Judah, and they shall kill me, and go again to Rehoboam king of Judah.
verses.web: If this people goes up to offer sacrifices in LORD’s house at Jerusalem, then the heart of this people will turn again to their lord, even to Rehoboam king of Judah; and they will kill me, and return to Rehoboam king of Judah.”
verses.ct: If these people keep going up to offer sacrifices at the LORD's house in Jerusalem, their loyalty will shift back to their lord Rehoboam king of Judah. They'll kill me and return to him."

verses.kjv: Whereupon the king took counsel, and made two calves of gold, and said unto them, It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem: behold thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.web: So the king took counsel, and made two calves of gold; and he said to them, “It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem. Look and behold your gods, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt!”
verses.ct: So after getting advice, the king made 2 golden calves and told the people, "You've been going up to Jerusalem long enough. Look, Israel — here are your gods who brought you up out of Egypt!"

verses.kjv: And he set the one in Bethel, and the other put he in Dan.
verses.web: He set the one in Bethel, and the other he put in Dan.
verses.ct: He placed one in Bethel and the other in Dan.

verses.kjv: And this thing became a sin: for the people went to worship before the one, even unto Dan.
verses.web: This thing became a sin; for the people went even as far as Dan to worship before the one there.
verses.ct: This became a terrible sin, because the people traveled as far as Dan to worship before one of the calves.

verses.kjv: And he made an house of high places, and made priests of the lowest of the people, which were not of the sons of Levi.
verses.web: He made houses of high places, and made priests from among all the people, who were not of the sons of Levi.
verses.ct: He also built shrines on the high places and appointed priests from all sorts of people who were not Levites.

verses.kjv: And Jeroboam ordained a feast in the eighth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, like unto the feast that is in Judah, and he offered upon the altar. So did he in Bethel, sacrificing unto the calves that he had made: and he placed in Bethel the priests of the high places which he had made.
verses.web: Jeroboam ordained a feast in the eighth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, like the feast that is in Judah, and he went up to the altar. He did so in Bethel, sacrificing to the calves that he had made, and he placed in Bethel the priests of the high places that he had made.
verses.ct: Jeroboam established a festival on the 15th day of the 8th month, imitating the festival held in Judah, and he went up to the altar. He did this in Bethel, sacrificing to the calves he had made, and he stationed the priests of the high places he had set up there in Bethel.

verses.kjv: So he offered upon the altar which he had made in Bethel the fifteenth day of the eighth month, even in the month which he had devised of his own heart; and ordained a feast unto the children of Israel: and he offered upon the altar, and burnt incense.
verses.web: He went up to the altar which he had made in Bethel on the fifteenth day in the eighth month, even in the month which he had devised of his own heart; and he ordained a feast for the children of Israel, and went up to the altar, to burn incense.
verses.ct: On the 15th day of the 8th month — a date he had chosen on his own — he went up to the altar he had built in Bethel. He established this festival for the people of Israel, and he offered sacrifices and burned incense on the altar.
